DataElement.preferredName: Clinical Significant Comorbidity Assessment Prior Preparative Regimen Timepoint Present Yes No Not Done Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not a clinically significant comorbidity was present prior to the start of the preparative regimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Clinical Significant Comorbidity Assessment Prior Preparative Regimen Timepoint Present
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity._A term applied to differences, correlations, cause-and-effect relationships, etc., to indicate that they are noticeable, probably too closely correlated to be attributed to chance and therefore indicating a systematic relation: substantial, fairly large; also having consequence or import, important in effect or meaning. In statistics significant ordinarily indicates a probability of not less than 95 percent, while highly significant indicates a probability of not less than 99 percent._The coexistence of two or more disease processes._The act of judging the value, significance, or extent of something._Earlier in time or order._The chemotherapy and/or radiation given to bone marrow transplant patients prior to transplant to kill diseased cells and/or make space for healthy new marrow and/or suppress the immune system so graft rejection does not occur._A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event._Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the examination and treatment of patients.:A term applied to differences, correlations, cause-and-effect relationships, etc., to indicate that they are noticeable, probably too closely correlated to be attributed to chance and therefore indicating a systematic relation: substantial, fairly large; also having consequence or import, important in effect or meaning. In statistics significant ordinarily indicates a probability of not less than 95 percent, while highly significant indicates a probability of not less than 99 percent.:The coexistence of two or more disease processes.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.

A term applied to differences, correlations, cause-and-effect relationships, etc., to indicate that they are noticeable, probably too closely correlated to be attributed to chance and therefore indicating a systematic relation: substantial, fairly large; also having consequence or import, important in effect or meaning. In statistics significant ordinarily indicates a probability of not less than 95 percent, while highly significant indicates a probability of not less than 99 percent.
The coexistence of two or more disease processes.

Property.preferredName: Assessment Prior Preparative Regimen Timepoint Present
Property.preferredDefinition: Having determined the value, significance, or extent of.:Earlier in time or order.:The chemotherapy and/or radiation given to bone marrow transplant patients prior to transplant to kill diseased cells and/or make space for healthy new marrow and/or suppress the immune system so graft rejection does not occur.:A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.:Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

The chemotherapy or radiation given prior to blood, marrow, cord blood transplant, or cell infusion to kill diseased cells and make space for the healthy new graft and/or suppress the immune system so rejection does not occur.
A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Text term to signify an affirmative response, negative response, or indication that an event did not occur.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or completed.

Concepts.definition: Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or not been completed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Affirmative response to a question or activity.:No value exists.:No Value Exists:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or not been completed.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
